title: If you don't pay rent or have a mortgage can you claim the IRS standard expense for these things?
question: I am one of the crefitors who's debt is about to be discharged. I believe that the means test was manipulagted so that the debetor would pass the presumption of abuse. What can I do?
answers:
The IRS Standards are used in the means test and as a measure in the current monthly income schedule. Your actual expenses are used in the current monthly income test. If you monthly expenses are higher than the IRS standards there must be a plausible explanation for the higher costs.
You should consult with a knowledgeable bankruptcy attorney in your area before you file so that you obtain the most relief for your fresh start.
Hire counsel. Bankruptcy proceedings are not DIY. No federal matter is.
You are allowed to be represented in bankruptcy court and you can oppose the discharge.
